name: Pope Paul I

locations.description: Pope from 757 to 767, brother of Pope Stephen II

summary: Paul I was Pope from 757 to 767. He was the brother of his predecessor, Pope Stephen II. He continued Stephen's policies of maintaining the alliance with the Franks and protecting the Papal States from the Lombards. He was known for his piety and his efforts to preserve and venerate the relics of the saints. He built several churches in Rome and worked to strengthen the position of the papacy.
